channel.title: PI Need Help Putting Server Online
channel.description:
ive got everything i need, i have also portforwarded but i cannot find "Server =" or "No-ip" anywhere therefore i cannot put it online, please help </3
Skype: iiixsmudgerxiii
will screenshare just help me throgh that.

item.title: PI Need Help Putting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @Lirimoo Lirimoo
item.description:
@Lirimoo wrote:

[quote=“Smudgerx360, post:3, topic:509927”][quote author=Andy1993 link=topic=628173.msg4267542#msg4267542 date=1364230372]
On your client folders search for “Server” in Client.java and see what it says if it says 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or Localhost… then replace with your No-ip and save, compile… then make sure your No-ip is active.

Also if your using Vista/windows 7 in the search bar on the folder type “localhost” “no-ip” ect and make sure everything is what you need it to be.
[/quote]

im using XP And ive tried that, nothing compes up i changed ONE of the 127.0.0.1 to my server ip but when i try logging in, nothing comes up on the CMD and the client says “Please choose a different game world.” or “Error connecting to Server”.

EDIT I GET THIS - THIS IS THE ONLY ONE I HAVE LEFT!:
if((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0) {

				if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals("127.0.0.1") || 1 == 1) {
					if(inputString.equals("region")) {
						System.out.println("Current region: " + anInt1069 + ", " + anInt1070);
					}[/quote]

Got Teamviewer ?
If yes, PM me your details.

Read full topic
item.source: PI Need Help Putting Server Online

item.title: PI Need Help Putting Server Online
item.dc:creator: @Smudgerx360 Smudgerx360
item.description:
@Smudgerx360 wrote:

[quote=“Andy1993, post:2, topic:509927”]On your client folders search for “Server” in Client.java and see what it says if it says 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or Localhost… then replace with your No-ip and save, compile… then make sure your No-ip is active.

Also if your using Vista/windows 7 in the search bar on the folder type “localhost” “no-ip” ect and make sure everything is what you need it to be.[/quote]

im using XP And ive tried that, nothing compes up i changed ONE of the 127.0.0.1 to my server ip but when i try logging in, nothing comes up on the CMD and the client says “Please choose a different game world.” or “Error connecting to Server”.

EDIT I GET THIS - THIS IS THE ONLY ONE I HAVE LEFT!:
if((j == 13 || j == 10) && inputString.length() > 0) {

				if(myPrivilege >= 2 || server.equals("127.0.0.1") || 1 == 1) {
					if(inputString.equals("region")) {
						System.out.println("Current region: " + anInt1069 + ", " + anInt1070);
					}

Read full topic
item.source: PI Need Help Putting Server Online

item.title: PI Need Help Putting Server Online

@Andy1993 wrote:

On your client folders search for “Server” in Client.java and see what it says if it says 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or Localhost… then replace with your No-ip and save, compile… then make sure your No-ip is active.

Also if your using Vista/windows 7 in the search bar on the folder type “localhost” “no-ip” ect and make sure everything is what you need it to be.
